strapiArticle.title: Bangus Sisig
strapiArticle.description: Flavorful Filipino dish made with milkfish.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 2 medium-sized boneless bangus (milkfish), steamed or fried and flaked
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 red chili peppers (siling labuyo), chopped (adjust according to your spice preference)
  • 2 tablespoons calamansi juice (or lemon juice)
  • 2 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon mayonnaise
  • 1 tablespoon butter
  • 1 teaspoon liquid seasoning (such as Knorr or Maggi)
  • Salt and pepper, to taste
  • Cooking oil, for frying
  • Fresh green onions or cilantro, for garnish

Instructions:

  1. In a large pan or skillet, heat cooking oil over medium heat. Add the flaked bangus and fry until slightly crispy. Remove the fish from the pan and set aside.

  2. In the same pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until softened and translucent.

  3. Add the minced garlic and chopped chili peppers to the pan. Sauté for a few minutes until the flavors meld together.

  4. Return the fried bangus flakes to the pan and mix well with the onion, garlic, and chili pepper mixture.

  5. Drizzle calamansi juice and soy sauce over the bangus flakes. Stir to combine.

  6. Add the mayonnaise and liquid seasoning to the pan. Mix well to coat the fish flakes evenly.

  7. Season with salt and pepper according to your taste preference. Adjust the spiciness by adding more chopped chili peppers if desired.

  8. Cook the Bangus Sisig for a few more minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together and the mixture to become slightly crispy.

  9. Remove from heat and transfer the Bangus Sisig to a serving dish.

  10. Garnish with fresh green onions or cilantro.

Serve the Bangus Sisig hot as a main dish or as a flavorful appetizer or pulutan (bar snack). Enjoy the delicious and tangy flavors of this Filipino favorite!
